description: From Middle English overberere, equivalent to overbear +â€Ž -er.

entries.meaning: one who overbears or is overbearing
examples: Underbearers in conversation are, undoubtedly, much less irksome than overbearers, yet too much hesitation and timidity render a man unfit for colloquial purposes; and we cannot but smile at Cowper's delineation of this very cautious gentleman.
